Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Business Asset that will be used for the Issue transaction.

Asset_Place_in_Service_Data.description: Date Asset is placed in Service

validation.validation: Submit a Place in Service Date on or between the asset's Acquisition Date and today

description: Data values used to issue a business asset

validation.validation: Only Depreciable Capital assets can be placed in service.
The asset must be in a Registered status to be placed in service. It may already be in service.
Cannot place an asset in service that is included in Composite Asset allocation. Assets that are components of a composite asset may not be placed in service.
Depreciation has already been recorded for the asset.
Depreciation profile for the asset must start depreciation Manually or Upon Issue.  Please verify that accounting has been assigned for the asset.
There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset can be placed in service.
validation.description: There is a pending event for the asset that should be completed before this asset can be placed in service.
